paper_abstract: In this paper, we propose a novel technique for word spotting in historical printed documents combining synthetic data and user feedback. Our aim is to search for keywords typed by the user in a large collection of digitized printed historical documents. The proposed method consists of the following stages: (1) creation of synthetic image words; (2) word segmentation using dynamic parameters; (3) efficient feature extraction for each word image and (4) a retrieval procedure that is optimized by user feedback. Experimental results prove the efficiency of the proposed approach.
paper_title: Keyword-guided word spotting in historical printed documents using synthetic data and user feedback
